title: feature request: app vs proxy
body:
so i'm new to owncloud, and i really like it so far. 
i was thinking about the problems of app/plugin style development, you see plugins potentially fail because there aren't as many qualified developers behind an app/plugin and those that do sometimes have other issues that begin to slowdown the maintenance of the app/plugin.

so i'm proposing that a modified version of the external app be made where the plugin acts as a proxy.
say that i wanted to access www.amazon.com. i add it to this "proxy" plugin, and then when i'm in my owncloud instance,  this would enable a number of uses, such as making use of tor through an remote server you run, purely browser based.  or it would allow you to consolidate interfaces for owncloud server.  lets say that i have owncloud, rnews, tor, mediawiki.
rather than port forward a bunch of ports through the external firewall, it would be nice to just be able to route those through owncloud.

say, i connect to owncloud through https://server0.test.net
when connected, i have the proxy app configured in owncloud to connect to 
http://localhost:4032 for rnews and http://localhost:4033 for tor and http://localhost:4034 for mediawiki
then after i login to owncloud, i can have full fledged web applications with a whole community accessible through owncloud with minimal external security exposure just be clicking the proxy links tabs on the left side very similar to how the external app/plugin currently works.

thanks!
